Home → Recommendations & reviews → Young Adult

Young Adult

Reviews, recommendations, posts and ideas for and by young adults.

The Exact Opposite of Okay by Laura Steven

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Jul 19, 2018

The Exact Opposite of Okay introduces teenage readers to important topics with humour and bold characters.

My Box-Shaped Heart by Rachael Lucas

Written by Amy Rush Da Silva · Published Jul 17, 2018

My Box-Shaped Heart is an easy, inspiring, uplifting, adorable summer read about the importance of family, friendship and finding your own happily ever after.

Flame in the Mist by Ren√©e Ahdieh

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Jul 12, 2018

Flame in the Mist is a completely immersive, diverse and great read.

Dear Martin by Nic Stone

Written by Amy Rush Da Silva · Published Jul 10, 2018

Dear Martin is an extremely powerful read which examines racism, police brutality, sexism, toxic masculinity and more.

Children of Blood and Bone by Tomi Adeyemi

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Jul 5, 2018

Children of Blood and Bone is gripping, awesome and effortlessly diverse.

The Weight of a Thousand Feathers by Brian Conaghan

Written by Amy Rush Da Silva · Published Jul 3, 2018

The Weight of a Thousand Feathers is a heart-breaking, beautiful book that touches on some very important issues regarding illness and family ties.

New Young Adult books for July 2018

Written by Sophie Green · Published Jun 29, 2018

This month's selections range from suspense to light humour, gritty realism to escapism.

The Hazel Wood by Melissa Albert

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Jun 28, 2018

The Hazel Wood is a mesmerizing, intriguing debut that will sweep you off your feet.

The Smoke Thieves by Sally Green

Written by Amy Rush Da Silva · Published Jun 26, 2018

The Smoke Thieves is a thrilling read with magic, exciting kingdoms, a fast-paced plot and characters you can't help but love.

Sunflowers in February by Phyllida Shrimpton

Written by Emily Mitchell · Published Jun 21, 2018

Sunflowers in February is beautiful and moving.

About our Young Adult section

Book reviews, reading suggestions and blog posts from our staff and young adult readers. Want to write for our website? Email us at help@suffolklibraries.co.uk.
